sen.j: 犬養五十君（いぬかいのいきみ、生年不明 - 天武天皇元年7月23日 (旧暦)（672年8月21日））は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: INUKAI no Kimi (Birth Year unknown - August 21, 672) lived during the Asuka period in Japan.
INUKAI no Ikimi (year of birth unknown - August 24, 672) was a person from the Asuka Period in Japan.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。
sen.e: INUKAI no Ikimi (year of birth unknown - August 24, 672) was a person from the Asuka Period in Japan.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは「いぬかひのいきみ」。
sen.e: The reading in the old Japanese syllabary characters is INUKAHI no Kimi.
In the old Japanese syllabary characters, his name was pronounced as 'INUKAHI no Ikimi.'
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: In the old Japanese syllabary characters, his name was pronounced as 'INUKAHI no Ikimi.'

sen.j: 姓（カバネ)は連。
sen.e: The Kabane (hereditary title) is Muraji.
His Kabane (hereditary title) was Muraji.
His Kabane (hereditary title) was Muraji.

sen.j: 646年に失政を犯した国司の部下として咎められた。
sen.e: He was implicated in the trial of the Kokushi (provincial governor) who committed corruption in 646.
In 646, he was charged in connection with Kokushi (provincial governor), his superior officer, who led misgovernment.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: In 646, he was charged in connection with Kokushi (provincial governor), his superior officer, who led misgovernment.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱では大友皇子（弘文天皇）の将として活躍したが、敗れて殺された。
sen.e: In the Jinshin War in 672, he flourished as a commander of OTOMO no Miko (Emperor Kobun) but was defeated and killed.
In the Jinshin War which broke out in 672, he fought for Prince Otomo (Emperor Kobun) as a competent commander but was defeated and killed.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: In the Jinshin War which broke out in 672, he fought for Prince Otomo (Emperor Kobun) as a competent commander but was defeated and killed.

sen.j: 少なくとも孝徳天皇の代のはじめ、おそらくその前代の皇極天皇の頃から、東国の国司紀麻利きたの部下の官人であった。
sen.e: From at least, in the beginning of Emperor Kotoku's reign, probably even from the reign of Empress Kogyoku, he was a government official under KI no Marikita, Kokushi (provincial governor) of Togoku (eastern province).

He is considered to be a government official who worked for KI no Marikita, Kokushi of Togoku (eastern province) at least from the early reign of Emperor Kotoku, or presumably Empress Kogyoku, the previous reign.
sen.cmt: であった -> であったと思われる と解釈しました。
sen.e: He is considered to be a government official who worked for KI no Marikita, Kokushi of Togoku (eastern province) at least from the early reign of Emperor Kotoku, or presumably Empress Kogyoku, the previous reign.

sen.j: 東国の中のどの国かは不明である。
sen.e: Where in Togoku(eastern province) is unknown.
The precise location of his origin in Togoku is unknown.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: The precise location of his origin in Togoku is unknown.

sen.j: 大化2年（646年）3月19日、東国の国司の仕事振りを監察した使者の言で、紀麻利耆拖の犯した罪に関連して、犬飼五十君も過失があるとされた。
sen.e: On March 19, 646, the envoy dispatched to scrutinize Kokushi of Togoku reported that INUKAI no Kimi is also at fault in relation to the crime committed by KI no Marikita committed.

On April 12, 646, the emissary carried out the investigation over the work performance of Kokushis in Togoku including KI no Marikita, and tendered a report that disclosed the misgovernment of Kokushi and the involvement of INUKAI no Ikimi.
sen.cmt: 大化2年3月19日は西暦646年4月12日です。
sen.e: On April 12, 646, the emissary carried out the investigation over the work performance of Kokushis in Togoku including KI no Marikita, and tendered a report that disclosed the misgovernment of Kokushi and the involvement of INUKAI no Ikimi.

sen.j: このときは同時に多数の国司・官人が弾劾されており、天皇は罪があったものを戒めつつ大赦した。
sen.e: In this incident, there were a great number of Kokushis and government officials who were impeached, and the emperor admonished the convicted but granted amnesty afterwards
In this incident, there were a great number of Kokushis and government officials who were impeached, and the emperor gave an admonishment to the criminals and granted amnesty afterwards.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: In this incident, there were a great number of Kokushis and government officials who were impeached, and the emperor gave an admonishment to the criminals and granted amnesty afterwards.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』のこの記事では、姓なしに「犬養五十君」と記されている。
sen.e: In the article on this in "Chronicles of Japan", INUKAI no Kimi is written about and described without his hereditary name.
In the article on this matter in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), INUKAI no Ikimi is mentioned without his hereditary title.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: In the article on this matter in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan), INUKAI no Ikimi is mentioned without his hereditary title.

sen.j: その後、斉明天皇、天智天皇の代に犬養五十君に関する記録はなく、672年の壬申の乱で、「犬養連五十君」が大友皇子側の将として現れる。
sen.e: After that, there is no record about him through the reigns of Empress Saimei and Emperor Tenchi, and in the description of the Jinshin War in 672, "INUKAI no Kimi" appears as a commander on OTOMO no Miko's side.

No records about INUKAI no Ikimi are found during the reigns of Empress Saimei and Emperor Tenchi until his name 'INUKAI no Muraji Ikimi' appears as the commander of Prince Otomo in 672, in the Jinshin War.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: No records about INUKAI no Ikimi are found during the reigns of Empress Saimei and Emperor Tenchi until his name 'INUKAI no Muraji Ikimi' appears as the commander of Prince Otomo in 672, in the Jinshin War.

sen.j: 大海人皇子（天武天皇）にくみして倭（大和国）で兵を挙げた大伴吹負の軍に対し、五十君は北から攻撃する将になった。
sen.e: He was the commander who faced OTOMO no Hukei who formed armies in Wa (Yamato Province) and joined OAMA no Miko (Emperor Tenmu) and he attacked them from the north.
OTOMO no Fukei rose in arms in Yamato (Yamato Province) taking the side of Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu), and Ikimi was the commander attacking the troops of Fukei from the north side.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: OTOMO no Fukei rose in arms in Yamato (Yamato Province) taking the side of Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu), and Ikimi was the commander attacking the troops of Fukei from the north side.

sen.j: 7月4日に勝利をあげながら退いた大野果安と交代したものだが、その日付ははっきりしない。
sen.e: The date is unknown but he took over from ONO no Hatayasu who brought the victory in the battle on July 4 nevertheless retreated after that.
Ikimi took part in the attack of Fukei taking over the place of ONO no Hatayasu who brought the victory in the battle on August 5, but the precise date of the replacement is unknown.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: Ikimi took part in the attack of Fukei taking over the place of ONO no Hatayasu who brought the victory in the battle on August 5, but the precise date of the replacement is unknown.

sen.j: このとき、西の河内国から進攻して協同するはずだった味方の壱伎韓国は既に敗れ、敵の大友吹負は東方から数万人の増援を受け取っていた。
sen.e: IKI no Karakuni was already defeated although he was supposed to advance from western Kawachi Province and cooperate, and on the contrary the enemy, OTOMO no Hukei had received tens of thousand of reinforcement.
In this battle, IKI no Karakuni who had intended to join the attack from the west side had been defeated, and troops of OTOMO no Fukei, the enemy, received tens of thousands of reinforcement.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: In this battle, IKI no Karakuni who had intended to join the attack from the west side had been defeated, and troops of OTOMO no Fukei, the enemy, received tens of thousands of reinforcement.

sen.j: 大友吹負は軍を大和の古道に分けて配置した。
sen.e: OTOMO no Hukei divided his troops and positioned them in the ancient roads in Yamato.
OTOMO no Fukei allocated his troops on the ancient roads of Yamato.
OTOMO no Fukei allocated his troops on the ancient roads of Yamato.

sen.j: 犬養五十君は、中道を進んで村屋に布陣し、別将廬井鯨に200の精兵を与えて、中道にあった吹負の本営を衝かせた。
sen.e: INUKAI no Kimi advanced through the Naka no michi (middle road) and formed up in Muraya, provided another commander, IOI no Kujira, of 200 experts and had them attack the Hukei's head quarter in Naka no michi.

INUKAI no Ikimi advanced his troops along Nakatsu-michi Road and set up a camp at Muraya and had IOI no Kujira, another commander, attack the headquarters of Fukei's troops in Nakatsu-michi Road with his 200 warfare experts.
sen.cmt: ひとつ前の原文に「大和の古道」とあるため「中道」は「なかつみち」と解釈しました。
sen.e: INUKAI no Ikimi advanced his troops along Nakatsu-michi Road and set up a camp at Muraya and had IOI no Kujira, another commander, attack the headquarters of Fukei's troops in Nakatsu-michi Road with his 200 warfare experts.

sen.j: 鯨は優勢だったが徳麻呂ら5人の働きで止められた。
sen.e: Kujira had an advantage but 5 units including Tokomaro managed to stop him.
Kujira had an advantage but 5 units including Tokomaro managed to stop his troops.
Kujira had an advantage but 5 units including Tokomaro managed to stop his troops.

sen.j: この間に、三輪高市麻呂と置始兔が率いる敵軍が箸陵で犬養の軍の左翼を破り、鯨の背後にまわった。
sen.e: During this time, the enemy led by MIWA no Takechimaro and OKISOME no Usagi defeated the left flank of INUKAI's forces in Hashi no Haka and got the rear of Kujira.
During this battle, the enemy forces led by MIWA no Takechimaro and OKISOME no Usagi broke through the left side of INUKAI's troops in Hashi no Haka and attacked Kujira's troops from behind.
sen.cmt: 箸陵：はしはか、はしのはか、はしのみつか がありますが、trans1のままとします。
sen.e: During this battle, the enemy forces led by MIWA no Takechimaro and OKISOME no Usagi broke through the left side of INUKAI's troops in Hashi no Haka and attacked Kujira's troops from behind.

sen.j: 鯨は敗走した。
sen.e: Kujira fled.
Kujira was defeated and fled.
Kujira was defeated and fled.

sen.j: この戦いの日付はわからない。
sen.e: The date of this battle is unknown.
The date of this battle is unknown.
The date of this battle is unknown.

sen.j: 戦いの後、吹負は追撃せずに軍を立て直すため倭京に戻った。
sen.e: After the battle, Hukei did not pursue them but returned to Wakyo and restored his armed forces.
After the battle, Fukei did not pursue them but returned to Wakyo (a city in Yamato) and restored his armed forces.
sen.cmt: (a city in Yamato) を追記しました。
sen.e: After the battle, Fukei did not pursue them but returned to Wakyo (a city in Yamato) and restored his armed forces.

sen.j: 犬養五十君はこれ以後倭の方面には攻撃をかけなかった。
sen.e: INUKAI no Kimi had never attacked towards Wa after this.
INUKAI no Ikimi had never attacked Yamato region after the battle.
INUKAI no Ikimi had never attacked Yamato region after the battle.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』に明言はされないが、主戦線の近江国の戦況が悪化したため、そちらに転じた可能性がある。
sen.e: This is not mentioned in "Chronicles of Japan" but he may have turned to the main battle line of Omi Province as its war situation deteriorated.
"Nihonshoki" doesn't clearly mention about the reason but Ikimi presumably had to join the main battle line in Omi Province as the war situation was deteriorated.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: "Nihonshoki" doesn't clearly mention about the reason but Ikimi presumably had to join the main battle line in Omi Province as the war situation was deteriorated.

sen.j: 少なくとも、最終決戦となった7月22日の瀬田の戦いには五十君も参加したと思われる。
sen.e: At least, he is thought to have joined in the Battle of Seta on July 22 which was the final decisive battle of the war.
At least, he is thought to have joined in the Battle of Seta on August 23 which was the final battle of the war.
sen.cmt: decisive -> 削除しました。日付を西暦に変更しました。
sen.e: At least, he is thought to have joined in the Battle of Seta on August 23 which was the final battle of the war.

sen.j: 7月23日に、瀬田のそばにある粟津市で、犬養五十君と谷塩手は斬られた。
sen.e: On July 23, In Awazu near Seta, INUKAI no Kimi and TANI no Shiote were hacked to death.
On August 24, in Awazu near Seta, INUKAI no Ikimi and TANI no Shiote were slain by the enemy.
sen.cmt: 英文を書き換えました。
sen.e: On August 24, in Awazu near Seta, INUKAI no Ikimi and TANI no Shiote were slain by the enemy.

sen.j: 同じ日に大友皇子は自殺し、壬申の乱は終わった。
sen.e: On the same day, OTOMO no Miko committed suicide and the Jinshin War ended.
Prince Otomo committed suicide on the same day, and it was the end of the Jinshin War.
Prince Otomo committed suicide on the same day, and it was the end of the Jinshin War.
